clabulare: <entryFree id="n8467" type="main" key="cla_bu^la_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clābŭlāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>clabula = clavula</etym> <sense id="n8467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open wagon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">probably with sides of wicker-work</hi>, used in transporting soldiers, Cod. Th. 6, 29, 2, § 2.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">clābŭlāris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">clāv-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">clābŭlārius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the transport wagons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavularis cursus facultate permissā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 4, 11</bibl></cit>; Cod. Th. 8, 5, 62.</sense></entryFree>
clacendix: <entryFree id="n8468" type="main" key="clacendix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clacendix</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">claxendix</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">calcen-dix</orth>, <sense id="n8468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of shell-fish</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=46:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 46, 16</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 655</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
clades: <entryFree id="n8469" type="main" key="cla_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clādes</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<sense id="n8469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> usu. cladium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:63:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 63, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:22:8" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 22, 8</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cladum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:41" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:505" default="NO">7, 505</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:353" default="NO">9, 353</bibl>; 16, 672; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">32, 2, 1</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with Sanscr. klath, laedere; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kla/w</foreign>, to break, break in pieces; cf.: per - cello, clava, gladius</etym>. </sense><sense id="n8469.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">a breaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dashing to pieces;</hi> hence, </sense><sense id="n8469.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devastation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">injury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mischief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misfortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detriment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calamity</hi> (cf.: calamitas, pernicies; <cit><quote lang="la">class. and freq.): clades calamitasque, intemperies modo in nostram advenit domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec igitur subito clades nova pestilitasque Aut in aquas cadit aut fruges persidit in ipsas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare late cladem magnasque ruinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi cursum ingeni tui, Bruti, premit haec inportuna clades civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:97:332" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 97, 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque haec vetusta... Luctifica clades nostro infixa est corpori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:10:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et illam meam cladem... maximum esse rei publicae volnus judicastis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 13, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tibi ad pristinas cladis accessio fuisset Aetoliae repentinus interitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:37:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 37, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si primo proelio Catilina superior discessisset, profecto magna clades atque calamitas rem publicam oppressisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captae urbis Romanae clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:21:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 21, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum urbs tota eorum conruit et Taygeti montis magna pars... abrupta cladem eam insuper ruinā pressit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 79, 81, § 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus populationibus quam proeliis cladium fecit (cf. B. 1. infra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidve superbia spurcitia ac petulantia? Quantas Efficiunt clades!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliam quamvis cladem inportare pericli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 369</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum omni belli clade pervastat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonias belli clade premi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:7:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonias omni clade vastare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestas populi Romani... vastata cladibus fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 32, 57, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per sex dies septemque noctes eā clade saevitum est,</quote> <trans><tr>of the burning of Rome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo tantae cladis pretio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the burning of the Capitol</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">recens,</quote> <trans><tr>the destruction of the amphitheatre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:63 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 63 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lugdunensis,</quote> <trans><tr>the burning of Lyons</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 13</bibl></cit> Nipp. ad loc.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si denique Italia a dilectu, urbs ab armis, sine Milonis clade numquam esset conquietura,</quote> <trans><tr>without ruining Milo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:25:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 25, 68</bibl></cit>: tum privatae per domos clades vulgatae sunt, <hi rend="ital">the losses of particular families</hi> at Cannae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:56:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 56, 4</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cladibus, exclamat, Saturnia, pascere nostris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojae renascens alite lugubri Fortuna tristi clade iterabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8469.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n8469.4" n="1" level="3"> In war or battle, <hi rend="ital">a disaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defeat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discomfiture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">massacre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni pedites cum equitibus permixti magnam cladem in congressu facerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 59, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitatior hostis magnā clade eos castigavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iret ut... subitā turbaret clade Latinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:556" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 556</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi... supervenisset, ingens clades accipi potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 15</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so freq.: accipere cladem,</quote> <trans><tr>to be defeated</tr>, <tr>beaten</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 12, 17</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">22, 51, 11: apud Chaeroneam accepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classe devictā multas ipsi lacrimas, magnam populo Romano cladem attulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.D. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam is... contractae cladi superesset... fusa est Romana acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 19, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus pacis modo incurrisse agentibus magna clades inlata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vulnus super vulnus sed multiplex clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 54, 9</bibl></cit>: paene exitiabilem <cb n="CLAM" /> omnibus cladem intulit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 112, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantā mole cladis obrui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:54:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 54, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrestri simul navalique clade obruebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 207" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 207</bibl>: clades illa pugnae Cannensis vastissima, Claud. Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:17:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 17, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">binaque castra clade unā deleta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercituum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 5</bibl> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">quis cladem illius noctis fando Explicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germanica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Variana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pharsaliam Philippos et Perusiam ac Mutinam, nota publicarum cladium nomina loquebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 50</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut barbarorum Claudius agmina ... diruit... Primosque et extremos metendo Stravit humum, sine clade victor (i.e. of his own men),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8469.5" n="2" level="3"> Of the plague: <cit><quote lang="la">inque ipsos saeva medentes Erumpit clades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 562</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sue abstinent merito cladis, quā ipsos scabies quondam turpaverat, cui id animal obnoxium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 4</bibl></cit> Heraeus ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n8469.6" n="3" level="3"> Of the loss of a limb: <cit><quote lang="la">Mucius, cui postea Scaevolae a clade dextrae manūs cognomen inditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8469.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8469.8" n="A" level="2"> Of persons who bring destruction, etc., <hi rend="ital">a destroyer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scourge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">geminos, duo fulmina belli, Scipiadas, cladem Libyae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:843" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 843</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec clades,</quote> <trans><tr>of Heliogabalus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 34, 1</bibl></cit>: illa, <hi rend="ital">of immodest women</hi> as a class, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Alex. Sev. 34, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8469.9" n="B" level="2"> Of dissolute morals, <hi rend="ital">corruption</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fecunda culpae saecula nuptias inquinavere... Hoc fonte derivata clades In patriam populumque fluxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
claeon: <entryFree id="n8470" type="main" key="Claeon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Claeon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*klai/wn</foreign> (wailing), <sense id="n8470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain in Phrygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 16, § 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clagalopes: <entryFree id="n8471" type="gloss" key="cla^ga^lo_pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clăgălōpes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of eagle</hi>, = pygargus, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 138</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clam: <entryFree id="n8472" type="main" key="clam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clam</orth> (old access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">callim</orth>, <itype>or</itype>, acc. to Cod. Gu. 1, <orth extent="full" lang="la">calam</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=47:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 47, 3</bibl> Müll.) [root cal-; cf.: calix, celo, cella, occulo, caligo], <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos>, <sense id="n8472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privately;</hi> and in the predicate after sum and fore, <hi rend="ital">hidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi> (opp. palam; except once in Caes., v. II. infra; in class. prose only used as <pos>adv.</pos>). </sense><sense id="n8472.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8472.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: clamque palamque, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4</bibl> (247 Vahl.): ignis mortalibus clam Divisus, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea nunc facinora aperiuntur, clam quae speravi fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1157</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec id clam esse potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 36, 6</bibl></cit>: clam mordax canis (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">laqrodh/kths ku/wn</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 27</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 21, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 14, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clam peperit uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc tu mihi vel vi, vel clam, vel precario Fac tradas (a jurid. formula),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:32:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 32, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui propter avaritiam clam depositum non reddidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:8:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clam mussitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 31, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemissis confestim clam cohortibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille Sychaeum Clam ferro incautum superat,</quote> <trans><tr>stealthily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 350</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dic quid doleas, clam tamen usque dole,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 694</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui te commisit alendum Clam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 432</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:310" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 310</bibl> al.— </sense><sense id="n8472.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n8472.4" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">advv.;</hi> with furtim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 49</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with furtive,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with occulte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> with tacitus: <cit><quote lang="la">tacito clam venit illa pede, and similar words,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:34" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:6:16" default="NO">4, 6, 16</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">strepito nullo clam reserare fores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 60</bibl></cit>; opp. palam, Enn. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 9, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:84" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and opp. propalam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8472.5" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res exulatum at illam clam abibat patris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 1, 43</bibl></cit> Ritschl (cf. <foreign lang="greek">la/qrh *laome/dontos</foreign>, Hom. Il. 5, 269).—</sense><sense id="n8472.6" n="3" level="3"> Clam est, with <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi> (cf. II. B. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">meretricem commoneri Quam sane magni referat, nil clam'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8472.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without the knowledge of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknown to</hi>, constr. with <case>abl.</case> or <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n8472.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> (only in the two foll. passages; for <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 107 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 107 al.</bibl>, where the <case>abl.</case> formerly stood with clam, have been corrected by Ritschl and recent edd.; v. Speng. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 52</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but cf. Ussing ad Plaut. Curc. l.l.): nec clam durateus Trojanis Pergama partu Inflammasset equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 476</bibl></cit> Munro ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non sibi clam vobis salutem fuga petivit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8472.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clam uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:Grex. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. Grex. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 54</bibl>: clam uxorem et clam filium, <pb n="348" /> <cb n="CLAM" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 37</bibl> Speng.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:Grex. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. Grex. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 4, 6, 3</bibl> Ritschl: <cit><quote lang="la">virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. prol. 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clam alter alterum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnīs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. prol. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clam praesidia Pompeii, Auct. B. Hisp. 3: clam quemdam Philonem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27:section=14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 27, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec clam me omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8472.10" n="B" level="2"> Clam me est, <hi rend="ital">it is unknown to me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I know not</hi> (only in Plaut. and Ter.): <cit><quote lang="la">neque adeo clam me est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud clam me est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 53</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 2, 1: nec clam te est, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 5, 52</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n8472.11" n="C" level="2"> Clam habere aliquem = celare aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to keep secret from one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal from</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 35</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 988</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Comm. Art. Don. p. 399" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> Comm. Art. Don. p. 399</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clamator: <entryFree id="n8473" type="main" key="cla_ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāmātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>clamo</etym>, <sense id="n8473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bawler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noisy declaimer</hi> (in oratory; <cit><quote lang="la">prob. only in the foll. exs.): ut intellegi possit, quem existimem clamatorem, quem oratorem fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:49:182" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 49, 182</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:21:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 21, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:26:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 26, 11</bibl> (Schneid. clamatus, i. e. vocatus); * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clamatorius: <entryFree id="n8474" type="hapax" key="cla_ma_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāmātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>clamator</etym>, <sense id="n8474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">screeching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clamorous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avis = prohibitoria,</quote> <trans><tr>a bird of bad omen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 14, 17, § 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clamatus: <entryFree id="n8475" type="main" key="cla_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāmātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>clamo</etym>, <sense id="n8475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crying aloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shouting</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 15, 279</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clamitatio: <entryFree id="n8476" type="hapax" key="cla_mi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāmĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>clamito</etym>, <sense id="n8476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a violent crying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clamor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clamito: <entryFree id="n8477" type="main" key="cla_mi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāmĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n8477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. pres. nom. plur.</hi> clamitantis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 356</bibl>), 1, <hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [clamo], <hi rend="ital">to cry out violently</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bawl out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vociferate</hi> (class., esp. freq. since the Aug. per.; in Cic. only twice; not in Quint.; usu. of human beings). </sense><sense id="n8477.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut illi clamitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a bird: ipsum (passerem) accipiter ... vano clamitantem interficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8477.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8477.3" n="A" level="2"> With the words or thoughts uttered as object. </sense><sense id="n8477.4" n="1" level="3"> With direct citation: <cit><quote lang="la">Chremes clamitans: Indignum facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque clamitas, Laterensis: quo usque ista dicis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:31:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 31, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam caricas vendens Cauneas clamitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 40, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volero, clamitans provoco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:55:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 55, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad arma, et: pro vestram fidem, cives, clamitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 24, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:48:12" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 48, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8477.5" n="2" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamitabat falsa esse illa, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:25:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe clamitans, liberum se... esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 7</bibl></cit>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamitare coepit... ad Philotam decurrisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:27" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8:7" default="NO">9, 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:7:10" default="NO">10, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamitans non corporis esse sed loci morbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 29</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 10</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multisque sciscitantibus cuinam eam ferrent... Thalassio ferri clamitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n8477.6" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Messalina clamitabat... audiret Octaviae matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mnester clamitans aspiceret verberum notas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 36</bibl></cit>; 16, 10.—</sense><sense id="n8477.7" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid clamitas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec Volscio clamitante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum clamitant nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeva et detestanda alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to imprecate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8477.8" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acerronia... dum se Agrippinam esse utque subveniretur matri principis clamitat, conficitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">neve consulatus sui collegam dederet liberto... clamitabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8477.9" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">personal obj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamitant me ut revortar,</quote> <trans><tr>call on me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 30</bibl></cit> Lorenz (Fleck. inclamitant): <cit><quote lang="la">clamitent Ne sycophantam,</quote> <trans><tr>call</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamitans eum modo consulem modo dictatorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:page=34:13" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> p. 34, 13</bibl></cit> Bait.: <cit><quote lang="la">plausores, Augustianos militesque se triumphi ejus clamitantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 25</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8477.10" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">to proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reveal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">betray</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne ipsum caput et supercilia illa penitus abrasa olere malitiam et clamitare calliditatem videntur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clamo: <entryFree id="n8478" type="main" key="cla_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n8478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [Sanscr. kar-, to celebrate; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kale/w, klhto/s</foreign>; cf.: clarus, classis, nomenclator, concilium]. </sense><sense id="n8478.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to call</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cry out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shout aloud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to complain with a loud voice</hi>, vociferari (class. and very freq.; mostly of human beings): populus convolat; Tumultuantur, clamant, <cb n="CLAM" /> pugnant de loco, Ter. Hec. prol. alt. 33: <cit><quote lang="la">dic mihi, Non clamas? non insanis?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamare de pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:7:section=17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 7, § 17 al.</bibl></cit>—Of a vehement bawling before a tribunal: <cit><quote lang="la">qui quid in dicendo posset, numquam satis attendi: in clamando quidem video eum esse bene robustum atque exercitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 48</bibl></cit>.—In comedy, of snoring: dormit Sceledrus intus? <hi rend="ital">Lu.</hi> Non naso quidem: <cit><quote lang="la">Nam eo magnum clamat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 10 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n8478.2" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals and things; <cit><quote lang="la">of geese: anseres, qui tantummodo clamant, nocere non possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 57</bibl></cit>.—Of the chirping of a cricket: <cit><quote lang="la">(cicada) multo validius clamare occoepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 16, 7</bibl></cit>.—Of the roaring of waters, the rustling of trees, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:526" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 526</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:516" default="NO">9, 516</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:94" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamant amnes, freta, nubila silvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 116</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Also of abstract things (cf. under II. B.): et non ulla meo clamat in ore fides?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>does my sincerity never plainly proclaim itself in my voice?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 18</bibl></cit>.—But esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n8478.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to call</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cry aloud to something</hi> or <hi rend="ital">some one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to invoke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">call upon</hi>, etc., = exclamare; constr. with <hi rend="ital">acc. of the person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">a clause</hi> as object, in direct and (more freq.) in indirect discourse. </sense><sense id="n8478.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: e somno pueros clamo, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 372</bibl> P.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">janitorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:398" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 398</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ora clamantia nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:229" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 229</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 665: morientem nomine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 674</bibl></cit>.—With two <hi rend="ital">accs.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se causam crimenque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 9, 46: <cit><quote lang="la">te insanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem furem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:16:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 16, 15</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. rei</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divūm atque hominum fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 58: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturnalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchre! bene! recte!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 428</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8478.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With a clause as object, in direct discourse (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">ad me omnes clamant: Janua culpa tua est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:452" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 452</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 62</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 19, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 460</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 27:1 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 27, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8478.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With a clause as object, in indirect discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">clamant omnes indignissime Factum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid facto esset opus puerperae... illis clamat de viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:37:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 37, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solos felices viventes clamat in urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8478.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With final clause: <cit><quote lang="la">clamare coeperunt, sibi ut haberet hereditatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:19:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 19, § 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:5:1:section=55" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 5, 1, § 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamans in hostem, ne rex Croesus occideretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8478.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of abstract things, <hi rend="ital">to proclaim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom mi ipsum nomen ejus Archidemides Clamaret dempturum esse, si quid crederem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eum ipsum (sc. Regulum) clamat virtus beatiorem fuisse quam potantem in rosā Thorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 19, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (tabulae) se corruptas atque interlitas esse clamant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:42:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 42, § 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim restipulatio clamat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 13, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 21</bibl>; cf. clamito, Il.</sense></entryFree>
clamor: <entryFree id="n8479" type="main" key="cla_mor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāmor</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">clāmŏs</orth>, <itype>like arbos, labos</itype>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 13</bibl>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>clamo</etym>. <sense id="n8479.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A loud call</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cry;</hi> of men and (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>) of animals (very freq. in all periods and species of composition): <cit><quote lang="la">facere clamorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1</bibl>. 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:672 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 672 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollere in caelum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 745</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aethera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 338</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clamorem mittere ad sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:521" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 521</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:23:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 23, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">profundere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compesce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamorem audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno clamore concurritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor virūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impium Lenite clamorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 609</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nauticus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare clamorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">it clamor caelo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 451</bibl></cit> al. —</sense><sense id="n8479.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a friendly call</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acclamation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">applause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamor secundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixi de te tanto clamore consensuque populi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore coronae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 53</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">militum gaudentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:326" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 95, 326</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:73:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 73, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 5, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8479.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A hostile call</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clamor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shout</hi>: clamoribus maximis judices corripuerunt, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 2, 1</bibl>; so Cic. <cb n="CLAN" /> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:5:section=12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 5, § 12 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8479.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of animals, <hi rend="ital">a cry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gruum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 182</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:911" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 911</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mergorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 362</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 76</bibl></cit> al.—Of things, <hi rend="ital">noise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">din</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter scopuli clamorem inter cava saxa dedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium silvaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clamose: <entryFree id="n8480" type="main" key="cla_mo_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāmōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. clamosus, I.</entryFree>
clamosus: <entryFree id="n8481" type="main" key="cla_mo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>clamor</etym> (mostly post-Aug.), <sense id="n8481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of clamor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">noise</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n8481.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clamoring</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bawling continually</hi> or <hi rend="ital">loudly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clamorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noisy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bawling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbidus et clamosus altercator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:191" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:84:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 84, 2</bibl></cit>.— * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">clāmōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">clamorously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamose ne dicamus omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8481.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filled with noise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clamor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noisy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:18" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatri turba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:448" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 4, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:144" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:53" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Subura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 18, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae clamosus Helorus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:269" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 269</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8481.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Accompanied with noise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clamor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phasma Catulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:186" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adceleratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortes boum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4</bibl></cit>, pr. 1.</sense></entryFree>
clampetia: <entryFree id="n8482" type="main" key="Clampe^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clampĕtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lampe/teia</foreign>, <sense id="n8482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Bruttii</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Amantea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 38, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 19, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; the same, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clampĕtĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clancularius: <entryFree id="n8483" type="main" key="clancu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clancŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>clanculum</etym>, <sense id="n8483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">anonymous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unknown</hi> (postAug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">poëta quidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:3:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lydia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clanculo: <entryFree id="n8484" type="main" key="clancu^lo_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clancŭlō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (access. form of clanculum) [clam], <sense id="n8484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privately</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 133, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9</bibl>, p. 221, 13; 10, p. 245, 26; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 12, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Ep. 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clanculum: <entryFree id="n8485" type="main" key="clancu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clancŭlum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <sense id="n8485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prep. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">privately</hi> (ante-class. but freq.). </sense><sense id="n8485.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aucupemus ex insidiis clanculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abire a legione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctu advenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">congerere aliquod,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mordere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; 3, 5, 41; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 5, 54: agere inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 33</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n8485.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clanculum Patres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. clam.</sense></entryFree>
clandestino: <entryFree id="n8486" type="main" key="clandesti_no_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clandestīnō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. clandestinus <sense id="n8486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
clandestinus: <entryFree id="n8487" type="main" key="clandesti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clandestīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for clamdies-tinus; cf. matutinus; v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, p. 461 sq.</etym>, <sense id="n8487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clandestine</hi> (class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">suspitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 5, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:779" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 779</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus materiaï,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 11, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 18, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">introitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 81</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colloquia cum hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:12:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 12, 40</bibl></cit>: consilia, Crassus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:66:223" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 66, 223</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiis legationibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga, Auct. B. G. 8, 33: foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 36, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:267" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 267</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">denuntiatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 27</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">clandestīnō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">secretly;</hi> only Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 38, 19</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clango: <entryFree id="n8488" type="main" key="clango"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clango</orth>, no <sense id="n8488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>kindred with crocio, glocio; cf. clamo and <foreign lang="greek">kla/zw</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to clang</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resound</hi> (rare; only in ante-class. and post-Aug. poets): crepitu clangente, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 463, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrida clangunt signa tubae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:342" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 342</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">luctificum clangente tubā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:349" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 349</bibl></cit>: clangunt aquilae, Auct. Carm. Phil. 28.</sense></entryFree>
clangor: <entryFree id="n8489" type="main" key="clangor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clangor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>clango</etym>, <sense id="n8489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clang</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noise</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n8489.1" n="I" level="1"> Of wind instruments: <cit><quote lang="la">tubarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 313</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 526</bibl>; 11, 192; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 237</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:19" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:651" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 651</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:67" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 67</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 707</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8489.2" n="II" level="1"> Of birds (in crying or flying). clangorem fundere, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 10, 24: tremulo clangore volare, id. poët. Div. 2, 30, 63; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 528</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 611</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum magno clangore volitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 47, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:13:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:363 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 87, § 363 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 8, 10, § 23 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:13:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 13, 15</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:6 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 6 al.</bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 226</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8489.3" n="III" level="1"> Of dogs, <hi rend="ital">a barking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">baying</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clanis: <entryFree id="n8490" type="main" key="Cla^ni^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clănĭs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n8490.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Phineus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 140</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8490.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 379</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8490.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which falls into the Tiber</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Chiana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:455" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 455</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clanius: <entryFree id="n8491" type="main" key="Cla^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clănĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Campania</hi>, <pb n="349" /> <cb n="CLAR" /> <hi rend="ital">destructive by frequently overflowing the country around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially the town of Acerrœ</hi> (v. Acerrae), now <hi rend="ital">Lagno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 225</bibl> Heyne; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:537" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 537</bibl>; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Glănis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:53 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 53 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
clare: <entryFree id="n8492" type="main" key="cla_re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. clarus <sense id="n8492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
clareo: <entryFree id="n8493" type="main" key="cla_re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>clarus</etym>. <sense id="n8493.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">to be clear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to shine</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): hoc lumen candidum claret mihi, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 85, 25</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 367 Rib.); <cit><quote lang="la">so of stars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 5</bibl></cit> (240); 107 (348).—</sense><sense id="n8493.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8493.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be obvious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quod in primo quoque carmine claret,</quote> <trans><tr>which is evident also in the first canto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:937" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 937</bibl></cit>: mihi satis claret, with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Sev. 20, 4</bibl> Spald. and Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n8493.3" n="B" level="2"> Of character, <hi rend="ital">to be distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">illustrious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renowned</hi> (ante-class.): (Fab. Maximi) gloria claret, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 10</bibl> (Ann. v. 315 Vahl.); Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 85, 22</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 152 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
claresco: <entryFree id="n8494" type="main" key="cla_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clāresco</orth>, <itype>clārui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n8494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [clareo] (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose), <hi rend="ital">to become</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grow bright</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clear.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8494.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n8494.2" n="A" level="2"> Of the sight, <hi rend="ital">to begin to shine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become visible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta luminibus clarescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarescit dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 123" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 3</bibl>; cf. Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 185 al.—</sense><sense id="n8494.3" n="B" level="2"> Of the hearing, <hi rend="ital">to sound clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become audible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarescunt sonitus armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 301</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: vox, Gabius Bassus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8494.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8494.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To become clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manifest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obvious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alid ex alio clarescet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1456" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1456</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba ipso materiae nitore clarescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:19" default="NO">8, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:9" default="NO">6, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8494.6" n="B" level="2"> In character, <hi rend="ital">to become illustrious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">famous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">renowned</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">aliud clarescit et e contemptibus exit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:833" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 833</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoquo facinore clarescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnis inimicitiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia facilius inter ancipitia clarescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> C. Mall. Theod. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex gente Domitiā duae familiae claruerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
claricito: <entryFree id="n8495" type="main" key="cla_ri^ci^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭcĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. clarigito.</entryFree>
clarico: <entryFree id="n8496" type="main" key="cla_ri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭco</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>clarus</etym>, <sense id="n8496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to glow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gleam</hi>: ignes pernicitate sui claricantes, App. de Mundo, 15, p. 63.</sense></entryFree>
clarificatio: <entryFree id="n8497" type="main" key="cla_ri^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>clarifico</etym>, <sense id="n8497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glorification</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Qu. 83:62" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Qu. 83, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 77, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clarifico: <entryFree id="n8498" type="main" key="cla_ri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>clarus - facio</etym>, <sense id="n8498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make illustrious</hi> or <hi rend="ital">famous</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">nomen suum grandi aliquo facinore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 18, p. 213</bibl></cit> Bip.; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 4, 173</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 26, 304 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
clarigatio: <entryFree id="n8499" type="main" key="cla_ri^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>clarigo</etym>, <sense id="n8499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a solemn demand for redress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a religious solemnity with which the</hi> Fetialis <hi rend="ital">declared war upon an enemy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in case he should refuse to give satisfaction within</hi> 33 <hi rend="ital">days for injuries sustained</hi> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Dict. of Antiq.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, epit. libr. 22, 3, p. 69 Bip.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 5 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8499.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a fine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ransom</hi> for a transgression of limits, to be exacted of the offender by any person finding him: <cit><quote lang="la">(Veliterni) jussi trans Tiberim habitare, ut ejus, qui cis Tiberim deprehensus esset, usque ad mille passuum clarigatio esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clarigito: <entryFree id="n8500" type="hapax" key="cla_ri^gi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭgĭto</orth> (in the MSS. <orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭcĭto</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n8500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq.</hi> [clarigo], <hi rend="ital">to recall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recollect;</hi> saecla ferarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:947" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 947</bibl>; v. Lachm. ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
clarigo: <entryFree id="n8501" type="main" key="cla_ri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clārĭgo</orth>, no <sense id="n8501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v.n.</hi> [clarus]; t. t. of the Fetiales, <hi rend="ital">to proclaim war against an enemy with certain religious ceremonies</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 5 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg.
