vitam... clemens, placidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita urbana atque otium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit> (cf. with <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 7, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita quieta atque otiosa): ille suam semper egit vitam in otio, in conviviis: clemens, placidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 17, 17</bibl> (cf. the passages under clementia, cited from Flor.): <cit><quote lang="la">cupio, patres conscripti, me esse clementem: cupio in tantis rei publicae periculis me non dissolutum videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi satis clemens sum in disputando, tamen interdum soleo subirasci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Arimphaeis) ritus clementes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 13, 14, § 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8572.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to animals. <hi rend="ital">tame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">domesticated</hi>: clementius genus columbarum<pb n="353" /> <cb n="CLEM" />  (opp. agrestes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8572.8" n="B" level="2"> Specif. </sense><sense id="n8572.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Mild in respect to the faults and failures of others</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">forbearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indulgent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compassionate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merciful</hi> (class.; syn.: mitis, benignus, humanus, lenis, facilis, indulgens; <cit><quote lang="la">opp.: crudelis, inhumanus, asper al.): clementi (mi) animo ignoscet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 6, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judices et misericordes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 13, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir et contra audaciam fortissimus et ab innocentiā clementissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 3, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis interpres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominus facilis et clemens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justa et clemens servitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castigatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:38:137" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 38, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementior sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 31, 8</bibl></cit>.—More unusual: rumor, i. e. non nimius, <hi rend="ital">mild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mitigated</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">pra=os</foreign> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1202</bibl> P.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 22, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8572.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of places: <cit><quote lang="la">pars (insulae) ratibus clemens,</quote> <trans><tr>accessible</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 511</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">clē-menter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n8572.11" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to I. A.) <hi rend="ital">Gently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">softly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mildly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non desiit adsidue tremere Campania, clementius quidem, sed ingenti damno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:31:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 31, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitant venti oleas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spirant clementius Austri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:27" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.—So of moderate, slow action gen.: <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Sequere sis. <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Sequor. <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Clementer quaeso; <cit><quote lang="la">calces deteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 111</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 23</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n8572.12" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">By degrees</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gradually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementer et molliter assurgens collis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">editum jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:274" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 280" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 280</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">explorare, si quā Appennini juga clementius adirentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8572.13" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to II. A.) <hi rend="ital">Quietly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">placidly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquilly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calmly</hi>: accipere aliquid clementius aequo, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:314" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 314</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid est factum clementer, ut dissolute factum criminer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:8:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 8, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leniter hominem clementerque accepit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 40</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">86: ferre aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consolationes clementer admotae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo id pacto fieri possit clementissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo caudam clementer et blande movet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8572.14" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II. B.) <hi rend="ital">With forbearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mildly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with indulgence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementer et moderate jus dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementer a consule accepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementer ductis militibus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>peacefully</tr>, <tr>without plundering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementius tractare aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 24, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementissime scribere de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:18:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui victoriā civili clementissime usus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:23:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 23, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8573" type="main" key="Cle_mens2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clēmens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name</hi>, in later Lat. very freq.: <cit><quote lang="la">Julius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arretinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Flavius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clementia: <entryFree id="n8574" type="main" key="cle_menti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clēmentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. clemens</etym>. <sense id="n8574.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquil state of the elements</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mildness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquillity</hi> (like clemens in this signif. mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">clementia ventorum, tranquillitas maris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 52, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soli caelique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:18" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">emollit gentes clementia caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 366</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nascentis anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:13:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:527" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 527</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8574.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to clemens, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Indulgent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forbearing conduct towards the errors and faults of others</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mildness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">humanity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forbearance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benignity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clemency</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mercy</hi> (the class. signif.; very freq., esp. in prose; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: benignitas, comitas, lenitas, mansuetudo, etc.): clementia (est), per quam animi temere in odium alicujus concitati invectio comitate retinetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementia est temperantia animi in potestate ulciscendi, vel lenitas... in constituendis poenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: facilitas et clementia, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 25, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam clementiam mansuetudinemque nostri imperii tantam in crudelitatem inhumanitatemque esse conversam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:44:section=115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 44, § 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 15, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenitas et clementia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementia et probitas vestra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 1</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 18</bibl></cit> Spald., and antith. to jus asperius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 90</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. severitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephanti contra minus validos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leonis in supplices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 16, 19, § 48</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and as an attribute of princes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 44</bibl>; whence <hi rend="ital">a title of</hi> <cb n="CLEP" /> <hi rend="ital">the emperors</hi>, v. IV.—Less freq., </sense><sense id="n8574.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sympathy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satrapes violare clementiam quam regis opes minui maluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8574.3" n="III" level="1"> Clementia, personified as <hi rend="ital">a deily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of grace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:482 sq" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 482 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 6 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8574.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A title of the emperor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clementia tua,</quote> <trans><tr>Your Grace</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 65</bibl></cit>; Spart. ap. Geta, I. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cleobis: <entryFree id="n8575" type="main" key="Cle^o^bis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clĕŏbis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kle/obis</foreign>, <sense id="n8575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of the priesless Cydippe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brother of Bito</hi>, v. Bito; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4, 4</bibl>; Schol. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cleobulus: <entryFree id="n8576" type="main" key="Cle^o^bu_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clĕŏbūlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kleoboulos</foreign>, <sense id="n8576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of Lindus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Seven Sages</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Sept. Sap. 1, 16, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cleombrotus: <entryFree id="n8577" type="main" key="Cle^ombro^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clĕombrŏtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n8577.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Lacedœmonian general</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8577.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A young Academic philosopher of Ambracia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,029:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Scaur. 2, 4</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 1, 22.</sense></entryFree>
cleon: <entryFree id="n8578" type="main" key="Cle^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clĕon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kle/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n8578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8578.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Athenian popular leader</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:10:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 7, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8578.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rhetorician of Halicarnassus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 3, 5</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n8578.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A statuary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8578.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cleonae: <entryFree id="n8579" type="main" key="Cle^o_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clĕōnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Clĕōna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*klewnai/</foreign>. <sense id="n8579.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small town in Argolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Nemea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Hercules killed the lion</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Clenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 14, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 417</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 6, § 12</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8579.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clĕōnaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Cleonœ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Nemean lion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 612</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:34" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidus = leo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:28" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:60" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpis, i.e. Herculeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:837" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 837</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8579.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Macedonia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on Mount Athos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cleonia: <entryFree id="n8580" type="greek" key="cle^o_nia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clĕōnia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klewni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n8580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant</hi> helenium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cleonicion: <entryFree id="n8581" type="greek" key="cle^o_ni_ci^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clĕōnīcĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klewni/kion</foreign>, <sense id="n8581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> clinopodion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 87, § 137</bibl> (cleonicon, Sillig).</sense></entryFree>
cleopatra: <entryFree id="n8582" type="main" key="Cle^o^pa_tra^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clĕŏpātră</orth> (on the ā cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:109" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:1071" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 1071</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:56" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:120" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 120</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kleopa/tra</foreign>. <sense id="n8582.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Queen of Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and daughter of Ptolemy Auletes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notorious for her amorous intercourse with Cœsar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards with Antony; conquered at Actium by Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 354</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:464" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 464</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:22:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:59:5" default="NO">4, 59, 5</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8582.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clĕŏpātrānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Cleopatra</hi>: stirps, Treb. Poll. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uniones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Trig. Syr. 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8582.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sister of Alexander the Great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and wife of Alexander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:6:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:4 al" default="NO">13, 6, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8582.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Mithridates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and wife of Tigranes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 3, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8582.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of</hi> I., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:3:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 39, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:7" default="NO">39, 4, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cleophantus: <entryFree id="n8583" type="main" key="Cle^o^phantus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clĕŏphantus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kleo/fantos</foreign>. <sense id="n8583.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A physician in Rome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 16, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:31 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 15, § 31 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8583.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A painter of Corinthus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 3, 5, § 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cleophon: <entryFree id="n8584" type="main" key="Cle^o^phon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clĕŏphon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a demagogue of Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:10:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 10, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clepo: <entryFree id="n8585" type="main" key="cle^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clĕpo</orth>, <itype>psi, ptum</itype> (not clepi, v. Neue, Formenl. 2, 493; Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:25:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 25, 74</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root klep- of <foreign lang="greek">kle/ptw</foreign>, whence also clipeus; kindred with celo, cella, occul-o, clam</etym>, <sense id="n8585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to steal</hi> (rare, and mostly anteclass. for furor): sacrum qui clepsit rapsitve, old form. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 22</bibl>: si quis clepsit, etc., old form. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 10, 5</bibl>; Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:10:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 10, 23</bibl>; id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:27:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 27, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 6</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=94" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 94</bibl> Müll.; Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 5, 11</bibl> (v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 20, 14</bibl>; cf. Madvig. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:25:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 25, 75</bibl>); <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 562</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8585.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: sermonem, <hi rend="ital">to listen secretly to</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 20, 18</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">verba nostra auribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. p. 12" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. p. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se opificio,</quote> <trans><tr>to withdraw secretly from the work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. p. 20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. p. 20</bibl></cit>: se, <hi rend="ital">to conceal one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 156" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 799" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 799</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clepsydra: <entryFree id="n8586" type="main" key="clepsy^dra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clepsydra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kleyu/dra</foreign>, <sense id="n8586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument for measuring time by water</hi>, similar to our sand-glasses, <hi rend="ital">a water-clock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clepsydra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 130, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">used by speakers to measure the length of their discourse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 23, 2</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the time measured by the clepsydra</hi>, and hence, petere clepsydram, <hi rend="ital">to ask leave to speak;</hi> and dare clepsydram, <hi rend="ital">to give leave to speak</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 138</bibl>; Mart. <cb n="CLIE" /> 6, 35; cf. aqua, II. F., and Dict. of Antiq. pp. 508 sq.</sense></entryFree>
clepsydrarius: <entryFree id="n8587" type="gloss" key="clepsy^dra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clepsydrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>clepsydra</etym>, <sense id="n8587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of water-clocks</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 935, 8</bibl>.* † <orth extent="full" lang="la">clepta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kle/pths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a thief</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clericalis: <entryFree id="n8588" type="main" key="cle_ri^ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clērĭcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>clericus</etym>, <sense id="n8588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clerical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">priestly</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tirocinium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
clericatus: <entryFree id="n8589" type="main" key="cle_ri^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clērĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the clerical office</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 60</bibl>, n. 10; 125, n. 8 et saep.</sense></entryFree>
clericus: <entryFree id="n8590" type="greek" key="cle_ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clērĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klhriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n8590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a clergyman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">priest</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 60</bibl>, n. 10 al.</sense></entryFree>
clerumenoe: <entryFree id="n8591" type="greek" key="Cle_ru_me^noe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clērūmĕnoe</orth>, <itype>ōn</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*klhrou/menoi</foreign> (those who draw lots), <sense id="n8591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a comedy of Diphilus</hi>, Lat. Sortientes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 31</bibl>; cf. Rost. <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Cuped. XVIII. p. 5 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
clerus: <entryFree id="n8592" type="greek" key="cle_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clērus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klh=ros</foreign>, <sense id="n8592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the clerical order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the clergy</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 12</bibl>; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 4, 78 al.</sense></entryFree>
clibanarius: <entryFree id="n8593" type="main" key="cli_ba^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clībănārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>clibanus</etym>, <sense id="n8593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soldier clad in mail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cuirassier</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 6, 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clibanicius: <entryFree id="n8594" type="gloss" key="cli_ba^ni^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clībănĭcĭus</orth> <etym>id.</etym>: pānis, <sense id="n8594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bread baked in a</hi> clibanus, ls<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Orig. 20, 2, 15</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 27, § 105</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
clibanus: <entryFree id="n8595" type="greek" key="cli_ba^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clībănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kli/banos</foreign>, <sense id="n8595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an earthen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">iron vessel for baking bread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broader at the bottom than at the top</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 27, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:99" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 9, 39, § 99</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 19:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 21 al.</bibl>—As a utensil of the rich, also of silver, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 35, 6</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n8595.1" n="II" level="1"> Generally, <hi rend="ital">an oven</hi> or <hi rend="ital">furnace</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 30</bibl>; Sulpic. Sev. Dial. 1, 18.</sense></entryFree>
clidion: <entryFree id="n8596" type="greek" key="cli_di^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīdĭon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-um</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kleidi/on</foreign>, <sense id="n8596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the collar-bone of the tunny</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 18, § 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cliduchus: <entryFree id="n8597" type="greek" key="Cli_du_chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clīdūchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kleidou=xos</foreign> (keybearer), <sense id="n8597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two statues by Phidias and by Euphranor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19</bibl>, §§ 54 and 78.</sense></entryFree>
cliens: <entryFree id="n8598" type="main" key="cli^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clĭens</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">clŭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype> (<sense id="n8598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> usu. clientium; <cit><quote lang="la">clientūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 68:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 68, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 2, 1</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>comm.</gen> acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 77</bibl> P.; cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, 600, and v. clienta) [for cluens, from clueo, to hear; but acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 609</bibl>, from colens], <hi rend="ital">one who hears</hi>, in relation to his protector (patronus), <hi rend="ital">a client</hi> (Dion. Halic. 2, 9 and 10, pp. 83-85; cf. Nieb. Röm. Gesch. 1, p. 359 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:13:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 13, 2</bibl>; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:40" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 40</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and clientela): cluentes sibi omnes volunt esse multos... Res magis quaeritur, quam cluentum fides Quojusmodi clueat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 2, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>: PATRONVS. SI. CLIENTI. FRAVDEM. FECERIT. SACER. ESTO., Frag. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 609</bibl>; Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:13:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 13, 4</bibl>: neque clientes sine summā infamiā deseri possunt, C. Caesar ib. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 19</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n8598.1" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a client</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retainer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">follower;</hi> e. g. of an adherent of the Gaul Orgetorix, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 4</bibl> (metaph. <foreign lang="greek">u(ph/koos</foreign>); 6, 15; 6, 19; <cit><quote lang="la">of Segestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:57 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 57 al.</bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n8598.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A companion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum nobilium (Vergilius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 12, 15</bibl></cit> Dillenb. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n8598.3" n="3" level="3"> Of whole nations, <hi rend="ital">the allies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dependents</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">vassals of a more powerful people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 12 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n8598.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cliens Bacchi (i. e. qui est in tutelā Bacchi),</quote> <trans><tr>under the protection of Bacchus</tr>, <tr>a client of Bacchus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 78</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:77" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 77</bibl>, and clientela.</sense></entryFree>
clienta: <entryFree id="n8599" type="main" key="cli^enta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clĭenta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cliens</etym>, <sense id="n8599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female client</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 1, 2</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 77</bibl> P.; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 18, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pseudo</author> scon. ad Cic. Verr. 2, 1, 46, § 120</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
clientela: <entryFree id="n8600" type="main" key="cli^ente_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clĭentēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the relation of patron and client</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clientship; patronage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection;</hi> the intimate and reciprocal duties of attachment and interest, based on the private relations in Rome between a Roman of a lower grade (plebeian or freedman) or a foreigner, and the patron chosen by him (cf. Dion. Halic. 2, 9 and 10, pp. 83- 85; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1" default="NO">20, 1</bibl>): Thais patri se commendavit in clientelam et fidem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 9</bibl>; cf.: esse in fide et clientelā. <hi rend="ital">to be the client of</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:33:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 33, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferre se in fidem et clientelam alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 37, 106</bibl></cit>: scis quam diligam Siculos et quam illam clientelam honestam judicem,<pb n="354" /> <cb n="CLIO" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per nomen et clientelas inlustrior haberi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8600.1" n="b" level="4"> Very freq., mostly in <number>plur.</number>, concrete, <hi rend="ital">clients</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dependents</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplissimas clientelas acceptas a majoribus confirmare poterit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:64:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 64, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 11, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna esse Pompei beneficia et magnas clientelas in provinciā sciebat,</quote> <trans><tr>bodies of clients</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incedentibus regiis clientelis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 36</bibl></cit>; 13, 37; 14, 61; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 3</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:4:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 4, 8</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n8600.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">clientship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alliance</hi> (cf. cliens, B.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8600.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (cf. cliens, II.), <hi rend="ital">patronage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae sub clientelā musarum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clientulus: <entryFree id="n8601" type="hapax" key="cli^entu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clĭentŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cliens</etym>, <sense id="n8601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi> or <hi rend="ital">insignificant client</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clima: <entryFree id="n8602" type="greek" key="cli^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clĭma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype> (<sense id="n8602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> climatis, Firm. Math. 2, 13), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kli/ma</foreign> (prop. the inclination, slope; hence, cf. Lidd. and Scott under <foreign lang="greek">kli/ma</foreign>, II.), </sense><sense id="n8602.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A clime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">climate</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 98, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 859</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 49</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 246</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 1, 10</bibl>, used as Greek).—</sense><sense id="n8602.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen. for <hi rend="ital">region</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clima medium ventris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Act. Vet. 1, 43, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8602.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A land measure of</hi> 60 <hi rend="ital">feet square</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 5</bibl>.* † <orth extent="full" lang="la">clīmăcis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klimaki/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a small staircase</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ladder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 11, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
climacter: <entryFree id="n8603" type="greek" key="cli_macter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīmacter</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klimakth/r</foreign> (gradation), <sense id="n8603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a critical epoch in human life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a climacteric</hi> (in accordance with the ancient belief, the years 7, 14, 21, 28, etc.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 49, 50, § 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 9</bibl>; Firm. Math. 4, 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 14</bibl> (cf. <foreign lang="greek">klimakth/r</foreign> in Lidd. and Scott).</sense></entryFree>
climactericus: <entryFree id="n8604" type="greek" key="cli_macte_ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīmactērĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">klimakthriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n8604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a dangerous epoch in life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">climacterical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 9</bibl>, and climacter.* † <orth extent="full" lang="la">clĭmătias</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klimati/as</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of earthquake</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
climax: <entryFree id="n8605" type="greek" key="cli_max" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīmax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kli=mac</foreign> (a ladder), <sense id="n8605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rhetorical figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting in a gradual increase in force of expression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a climax</hi> (pure Lat. gradatio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 536</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 54</bibl>, used as Greek, and transl. by gradatio).</sense></entryFree>
climaxmegale: <entryFree id="n8606" type="main" key="Cli_max Me^ga^le_" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clīmax Mĕgălē</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">*kli=mac mega/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n8606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a narrow pass between Media and Asia Minor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 29, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clinamen: <entryFree id="n8607" type="hapax" key="cli_na_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīnāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>clino; cf. clinatus</etym>, = declinatio, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kli/sis</foreign>, <sense id="n8607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inclination</hi> or <hi rend="ital">turning aside</hi> of a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">principiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 292</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clinatus: <entryFree id="n8608" type="main" key="cli_na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [clino = <foreign lang="greek">kli/nw</foreign>], <sense id="n8608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inclined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sunk</hi> (only in the foll. exs.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">86</bibl> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 563</bibl>, read inclinata; v. Lachm. ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
clingere: <entryFree id="n8609" type="gloss" key="clinge^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clingĕre</orth>, <itype>cingere</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=56:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 56, 13</bibl> Müll.; cf.: clingit cludit, Isid. Gloss.</entryFree>
clinia: <entryFree id="n8610" type="main" key="Cli_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clīnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a young man in the Heautontimorumenos of Terence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
clinias: <entryFree id="n8611" type="main" key="Cli_ni^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clīnĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kleini/as</foreign>. <sense id="n8611.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The father of Alcibiades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 1</bibl>; hence, the latter is called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clīnĭădes</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:635" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 635</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8611.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Cretan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 5, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clinice: <entryFree id="n8612" type="greek" key="cli_ni^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīnĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klinikh/</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">te/xnh</foreign>), <sense id="n8612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the science of clinical medicine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praclice at the sick-bed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 2, § 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:98" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 11, 30, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clinicus: <entryFree id="n8613" type="greek" key="cli_ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīnĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kliniko/s</foreign> [<foreign lang="greek">kli/nh</foreign>, the bed]. <sense id="n8613.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A physician who attends patients sick in bed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:97" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 97</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">MEDICVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2983</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 205</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8613.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A patient confined to his bed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 105</bibl>, n. 5.—</sense><sense id="n8613.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bearer of the bier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sexton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grave-digger</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:24" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 24</bibl> (al. archiclinico; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 31</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n8613.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who was baptized when sick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">infirm</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
clino: <entryFree id="n8614" type="gloss" key="cli_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīno</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">kli/nw</foreign>, v. clinatus.</entryFree>
clinopale: <entryFree id="n8615" type="greek" key="cli_no^pa^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīnŏpălē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klinopa/lh</foreign>, <sense id="n8615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrestling in bed</hi>, = concubitus, Domit. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 22</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 11" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 11</bibl>, used as Greek).* † <orth extent="full" lang="la">clīnŏpŏdĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klinopo/dion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild basil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 87, § 137</bibl>.* † <orth extent="full" lang="la">clīnŏpūs</orth>, <itype>pŏdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">klino/pous</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the foot of a bed</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clio: <entryFree id="n8616" type="main" key="Cli_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clīo</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kleiw/</foreign>. <sense id="n8616.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Muse of history</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clio Cliusque sorores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="CLIT" /> 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8616.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Oceanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 341</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clipeo: <entryFree id="n8617" type="main" key="cli^pe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clĭpĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">clŭpĕo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">clypĕo</orth>), no <sense id="n8617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>clipeus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to arm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">furnish with a shield</hi> (rare): clamide contortā astu clupeat bracchium, <hi rend="ital">as with a shield</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 87, 26</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 186 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 7</bibl> Müll. (Rib. Trag. Lat., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:186" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> 186</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">clipeata agmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:793" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 793</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:436" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 436</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges virorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 110</bibl></cit> (transl. from Eurip. Phoen. 885).—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">clĭpĕātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who is armed with a shield</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 1, 54</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem adversus clipeatos habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:9:2 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 9, 2 al.</bibl> —Clipeata imago, <hi rend="ital">represented upon a shieldformed surface</hi> (cf. clipeus, II. D.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clipeolum: <entryFree id="n8618" type="hapax" key="cli^pe^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clĭpĕŏlum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">clŭp-, clyp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small shield</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 139" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clipeum: <entryFree id="n8619" type="main" key="cli^pe^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clĭpĕum</orth>, v. clipeus.</entryFree>
clipeus: <entryFree id="n8620" type="main" key="cli^pe^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clĭpĕus</orth> (in inscrr. and MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">clŭp-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">clyp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">clĭpĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:709" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 709</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:52:5" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 52, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10, 12</bibl>; 38, 35, 5; 40, 51, 3; Licin. et Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 196, 22 sq.</bibl> al.) [root in clepo]. <sense id="n8620.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The round brazen shield of Roman soldiers</hi> (diff. from scutum, which was oval, and made of wood covered with bull's hide; cf. Dict. of Antiq. p. 268 sq.), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=93" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 93</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 838</bibl> P. (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:364" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. 364</bibl> Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 195</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:30:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 30, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:99" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 44, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphic. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphic. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 19, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:443" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 443</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 626</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 447</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 621</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum post vulnera sumere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to do something when it is too late</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 35</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8620.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a shield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 433</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8620.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">objects in the form of a shield.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n8620.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The vault of heaven</hi>: in altisono caeli clupeo, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=73" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 73</bibl> Müll.—* </sense><sense id="n8620.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The disk of the sun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 192</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8620.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A round meteor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipei et vastorum imagines ignium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:1:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:7:20:2" default="NO">7, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 34, 34, § 100</bibl>.—But esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n8620.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A bust of the gods</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distinguished men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">represented upon a shield-formed surface</hi> (of gold, silver, etc., skilfully prepared, and often laid up as sacred gifts in the temples; so mostly in <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> form; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">scutis qualibus apud Trojam pugnatum est, continebantur imagines, unde et nomen habuere clipeorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 3, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 39, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8620.7" n="E" level="2"> Clipeum antiqui ob rotunditatem etiam corium bovis appellarunt, in quo foedus Gabinorum cum Romanis fuerat descriptum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=56" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 56</bibl> Müll. (cf. the same use of <foreign lang="greek">o(/plon</foreign>, Corp. Inscr. Graec. II. p. 664).</sense></entryFree>
clisthenes: <entryFree id="n8621" type="main" key="Cli_sthe^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clīsthĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kleisqe/nhs</foreign>, <sense id="n8621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a statesman and orator of Athens</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:16:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 16, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:7:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 7, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clitae: <entryFree id="n8622" type="main" key="Clitae1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clitae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 11, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8623" type="main" key="Clitae2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clitae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tribe on the coast of Cilicia Trachea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clitarchus: <entryFree id="n8624" type="main" key="Cli_tarchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clītarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*klei/tarxos</foreign>, <sense id="n8624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a companion of Alexander the Great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of whose life he wrote a history</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 11, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:5:21 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 5, 21 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
clitellae: <entryFree id="n8625" type="main" key="cli_tellae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clītellae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pack-saddle put upon beasts of burden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">especially upon asses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sumpter-saddle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 91</bibl>; Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 15, 8</bibl>.—Prov.: bovi clitellas imponere; v. bos, I.—</sense><sense id="n8625.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8625.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a place in Rome</hi>: clitellae dicuntur etiam locus Romae propter similitudinem, et in Viā Flaminiā loca quaedam devexa subinde et accliva, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=59:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 59, 15</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n8625.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An instrument of torture</hi>: est etiam tormenti genus eodem nomine appellatum, Paul. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
clitellarius: <entryFree id="n8626" type="main" key="cli_tella_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clītellārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>clitellae</etym>, <sense id="n8626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to a pack-saddle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bearing a pack-saddle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cliternini: <entryFree id="n8627" type="main" key="Cli_terni_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clīternīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the town Cliternum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the territory of the Æqui</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clitomachus: <entryFree id="n8628" type="main" key="Cli_to^ma^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clītŏmăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kleitsmaxos</foreign>, <cb n="CLOD" /> <sense id="n8628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Academic philosopher of Carthage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disciple and follower of Carneades</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 11 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 37, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clitor: <entryFree id="n8629" type="main" key="Cli_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clītor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clītŏrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n8629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 35, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 20</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> Clitori, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 316, 5</bibl> (cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 49</bibl>): Clitore, Liv. l. l.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clītŏrĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 322</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 13, § 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clitumnus: <entryFree id="n8630" type="main" key="Cli_tumnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clītumnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated in ancient times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose source received divine homage as</hi> Juppiter Clitumnus, now <hi rend="ital">Clitunno</hi> or <hi rend="ital">la Vene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 146</bibl> Serv. et Heyne; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 19, 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:547" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 547</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:453" default="NO">8, 453</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 43</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Clītum-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Clitumnus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clitumna novalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:128" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 128</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clitus: <entryFree id="n8631" type="main" key="Cli_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Clītus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*klei=tos</foreign>, <sense id="n8631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a friend of Alexander the Great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was killed by him in a fit of drunkenness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:1:9 al" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 1, 9 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cliva: <entryFree id="n8632" type="main" key="cli_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīva</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. clivus.</entryFree>
clivius: <entryFree id="n8633" type="gloss" key="clivius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clivius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: auspicia, <sense id="n8633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">which forbid any thing to be done</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=64:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 64, 10</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 14, 17, § 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clivosus: <entryFree id="n8634" type="main" key="cli_vo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīvōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>clivus</etym>, <sense id="n8634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hilly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of hills</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steep</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">rus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trames,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci et aridi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 4, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. planus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:R. R. 2:16:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 2, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 24, 55, § 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Olympus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:415" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8634.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tramite vitae,</quote> <trans><tr>steep</tr>, <tr>difficult</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:120" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
clivulus: <entryFree id="n8635" type="main" key="cli_vu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīvŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little hill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 144, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
clivus: <entryFree id="n8636" type="main" key="cli_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">clīvus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">clīva</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 195, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Limit. p. 43" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Limit. p. 43</bibl> Goes. dub.) [clino = <foreign lang="greek">kli/nw</foreign>, to incline], <sense id="n8636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gently sloping height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a declivity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an ascent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hill</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eminence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ascending road</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quā se subducere colles Incipiunt, mollique jugum demittere clivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 151</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 191</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
