coagmentum: <entryFree id="n8759" type="main" key="co^agmentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏagmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cogo</etym>, <sense id="n8759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining together;</hi> in concr., <hi rend="ital">a joint</hi> (in good prose; not in Cic.; mostly in <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n8759.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 42, 20 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 105 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 4, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8759.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a joining</hi> or <hi rend="ital">connecting together</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coagulare: <entryFree id="n8760" type="main" key="co^a_gu^la_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏāgŭlāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>coagulo</etym> (sc. intestinum), <sense id="n8760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the colon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 8, 16, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
coagulatio: <entryFree id="n8761" type="main" key="co^a_gu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏāgŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a curdling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coagulating</hi>, of a liquid (in the elder Pliny): <cit><quote lang="la">lactis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 18, § 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:158" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 10, 45, § 158</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coagulo: <entryFree id="n8762" type="main" key="co^a_gu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏāgŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (contr. COAGLAVI, Inscr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1177</bibl> Meyer), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>coagulum</etym>, <sense id="n8762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cause a fluid to curdle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coagulate</hi> (mostly in the elder Pliny): <cit><quote lang="la">lac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 123</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:147" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 14, 53, § 147</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">picem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 11, 22, § 53</bibl></cit>; v. Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 23, 97, § 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 15, 52, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mai, 9, 1 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
coagulum: <entryFree id="n8763" type="main" key="co^a_gu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏāgŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cogo</etym>, <sense id="n8763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of coagulation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a coagulum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coagulator</hi> (the curdled milk in the stomach of a sucking animal, the stomach itself, etc.), <hi rend="ital">rennet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">runnet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:237 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 41, 96, § 237 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:117" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 7, 63, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:830" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 830</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:545 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 545 al.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (causa pro effectu), <hi rend="ital">the curdled milk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 10, 45, § 162</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8763.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that which holds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">binds together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tie</hi> (only anteand post-class. and rare): hoc (vinum) continet coagulum convivia, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 28, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi atque amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae, Publ. Syr. 27: omnium aerumnarum, i. e. causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coalesco: <entryFree id="n8764" type="main" key="co^a^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ălesco</orth>, <itype>ălŭi, ălĭtum</itype> (<sense id="n8764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> only in Tac. and subseq. writers; <cit><quote lang="la">contr. form colescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1068" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1068</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1061" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 1061</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> (most freq. since the Aug. per.; never in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n8764.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To grow together with something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to unite.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8764.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1061" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1061</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa vides solā colescere calce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1068" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 1068</bibl></cit>: ne prius exarescat surculus quam colescat, <hi rend="ital">is united</hi>, sc. <hi rend="ital">with the tree into which it is inserted</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:18:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 18, 5</bibl></cit> and 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:1:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor cum terra mea coaluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:9:section=2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 39, 2, 9, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cilium vulnere aliquo diductum non coalescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 57, § 157</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 51, 76, § 166</bibl></cit>, and v. II. A. infra.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: cujus ex sanguine concretus homo et coalitus sit, <hi rend="ital">is formed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">composed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 171, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8764.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to unite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agree together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coalesce</hi> (so in the histt., esp. Liv. and Tac., very freq.); <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trojani et Aborigines facile coaluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 87:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 87, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solidā fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cum Patribus coalescerent animi plebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 48, 1</bibl></cit>: animi coalescentium in dies magis duorum populorum, id, 1, 2, 5.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo coalescere in populi unius corpus poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unum sonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bellum atrox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nomen nostrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hunc consensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">coalesce-re ad obsequium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi tantā concordiā coaluerant omnium animi, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 35, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:40:18" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 40, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vixdum coalescens foventis regnum (the figure taken from the growing together of a wound),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 31, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bellis civilibus sepultis coalescentibusque reipublicae membris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:90:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 90, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:4:8:5" default="NO">4, 8, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(voces) e duobus quasi corporibus coalescunt, ut maleficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:9:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 3</bibl> (v. the passage in connection): <cit><quote lang="la">quieti coaliti homines,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>united in a peaceful manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8764.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To grow firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strike root</hi>, <hi rend="ital">increase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">become strong.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8764.5" n="A" level="2"> Prop.. forte in eo loco grandis ilex coaluerat inter saxa, <hi rend="ital">had sprung up</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93, 4</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:92" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum novus in viridi coalescit cortice ramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 649</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8764.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take root</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be consolidated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum Galbae auctoritas fluxa, Pisonis nondum coaluisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <pb n="357" /> <cb n="COAR" /> coalitam libertate irreverentiam eo prorupisse, <hi rend="ital">strengthened</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 26</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas,</quote> <trans><tr>confirmed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coalito more asper,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by inveterate habit</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pravitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coalitus: <entryFree id="n8765" type="main" key="co^a^li^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏălĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from coalesco.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8766" type="hapax" key="co^a^li^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏălĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>coalesco</etym>, <sense id="n8766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">communion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fellowship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humani generis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 150</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coalo: <entryFree id="n8767" type="hapax" key="co^a^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ălo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sustain</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nourish together with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Jovin. 1, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coambulo: <entryFree id="n8768" type="main" key="co^ambu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-ambŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n8768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go with</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coangusto: <entryFree id="n8769" type="main" key="co^angusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-angusto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring into a narrow compass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to confine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hem in</hi> (rare and mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n8769.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: alvos, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo facilius fistula claudatur vel certe coangustetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Hisp. 5; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 42" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditum aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 2, 19</bibl></cit>.—Of a city, <hi rend="ital">to invest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besiege</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et coangustabunt te undique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 19, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8769.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrict</hi>: haec lex dilatata in ordinem cunctum, coangustari etiam potest, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:14:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 14, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid interpretatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:120" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 120</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n8769.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to afflict</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:33:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 33, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coaptatio: <entryFree id="n8770" type="main" key="co^apta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏaptātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coapto</etym>, <sense id="n8770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accurate joining together</hi> (a word coined by Augustine for translating the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a(rmoni/a</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 4, 2</bibl>; id. Civ. Dei, 22, 24.</sense></entryFree>
coapto: <entryFree id="n8771" type="main" key="co^apto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-apto</orth>, no <sense id="n8771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to fit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">join</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjust together with something</hi> (eccl. Lat.; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2</bibl>, pp. 135 and 248), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Christ. 1:14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Christ. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 557</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coarctatio: <entryFree id="n8772" type="main" key="co^arcta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏarctātĭo</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏarcto</orth>, v. coart-.</entryFree>
coaresco: <entryFree id="n8773" type="hapax" key="co^a_resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-āresco</orth>, <itype>ārui, 3</itype>, <sense id="n8773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dry</hi> or <hi rend="ital">become dry together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 11</bibl> (al. coaluerint).</sense></entryFree>
coarguo: <entryFree id="n8774" type="main" key="co^argu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-argŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, orig., <sense id="n8774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to assail a person</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thing in different directions</hi> (cf. arguo <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>); hence, jurid. t. t. </sense><sense id="n8774.1" n="I" level="1"> Aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to overwhelm with reasoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expose; convict of guilt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prove guilty</hi> (class., most freq. in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. convinco): Graecus testis... vinci, refelli, coargui putat esse turpissimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminibus coarguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:47:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 47, § 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illum natura ipsius consuetudoque defendat, hunc autem haec cadem coarguant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decreto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 28, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lentulum dissimulantem coarguunt praeter litteras sermonibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 47, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Libonem in senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in exprobrando et coarguendo acer (gestus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:92 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 92 al.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of the crime: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem avaritiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:59:section=153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 59, § 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commutati indicii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 71, § 187</bibl></cit>: facinoris <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8774.2" n="II" level="1"> Aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to prove incontestably a crime</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a wrong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fallacy</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">to demonstrate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">show to be wrong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to refute</hi> (cf. arguo, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">sin autem fuga laboris desidiam coarguit, nimirum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem certioribus argumentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum crimen multis suspitionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lacedaemoniorum tyrannidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temeritatem artis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iniquitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (legem) usus coarguit,</quote> <trans><tr>which experience has proved to be injudicious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 6, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 25, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod coarguunt fici,</quote> <trans><tr>disprove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domini coarguit aures,</quote> <trans><tr>betrays</tr>, <tr>publishes</tr>, <tr>makes known</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 193</bibl></cit> (cf. arguo, II. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>).—With a clause as object: <cit><quote lang="la">quod falsum esse pluribus coarguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Alex. 68.</sense></entryFree>
coargutio: <entryFree id="n8775" type="main" key="co^argu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏargūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coarguo</etym>, <sense id="n8775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a convicting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refutation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 41, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coarmio: <entryFree id="n8776" type="gloss" key="co^armi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏarmĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>co-arma</etym>, <sense id="n8776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comrade in arms</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2571</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coarmo: <entryFree id="n8777" type="main" key="co^armo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-armo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, āre</itype>, <sense id="n8777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to arm together</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 5, 45 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
coartatio: <entryFree id="n8778" type="main" key="co^arta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏartātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏarct-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coarto</etym>, <sense id="n8778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crowding together</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">laxatio aut coartatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurium in angusto tendentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:46:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 46, 2</bibl></cit>; so, militum eo loco, Auct. B. Alex. 74 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
coarticulo: <entryFree id="n8779" type="main" key="co^arti^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-artĭcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n8779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cause to articulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora mutorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coarto: <entryFree id="n8780" type="main" key="co^arto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-arto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏarcto</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <cb n="COCC" /> <sense id="n8780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to press together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confine</hi> (opp. laxo, dilato, etc.; class.). </sense><sense id="n8780.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">faenum in struem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:19:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:7:2" default="NO">8, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveum Tiberis (opp. laxo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angustae fauces coartant iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:8:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 35" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 35</bibl>: os et fauces sudario, <hi rend="ital">to strangle one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:7 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12, 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gnaeus in oppidis coartatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8780.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8780.3" n="A" level="2"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">to abridge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shorten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus sponsas habendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatus aliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox coartat iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:546" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 546</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus potestatis censoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8780.4" n="B" level="2"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">to abridge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Crassus haec quae coartavit et peranguste refersit in oratione suā, dilatet nobis atque explicet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 163</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plura in unum librum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:20:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8780.5" n="C" level="2"> ( = cogo.) <hi rend="ital">To compel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constrain</hi>: aliquem ad solutionem debiti, Cod. Th. 2, 29, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:57" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 57</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">coarctor e duobus,</quote> <trans><tr>pressed</tr>, <tr>urged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,011:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Phil. 1, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coassatio: <entryFree id="n8781" type="main" key="co^assa_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏassātio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏax-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coasso</etym>, <sense id="n8781.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joining of timber</hi> (<hi rend="ital">boards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">planks</hi>) <hi rend="ital">together;</hi> hence in concr., <hi rend="ital">a boarded floor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 1, 1</bibl> sq.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 62, § 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coasso: <entryFree id="n8782" type="main" key="co^asso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏasso</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cŏax-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> <etym>co-axis</etym>, <sense id="n8782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to join boards</hi> or <hi rend="ital">planks together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coassumo: <entryFree id="n8783" type="main" key="co^assu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏ-assūmo</orth>, <itype>sumpsi, sumptum, ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n8783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to assume together</hi>, Boëth. Arist. top. 6, 8.</sense></entryFree>
coatrae: <entryFree id="n8784" type="main" key="Co^a_trae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏātrae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, v. Choatrae.</entryFree>
coauctio: <entryFree id="n8785" type="main" key="co^aucti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏauctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coaugeo</etym>, <sense id="n8785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a joint increase</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:82:section=189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 82, § 189</bibl>; dub. al. leg. conjectio or conjunctio.</sense></entryFree>
coaxatio: <entryFree id="n8786" type="main" key="co^axa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏaxātĭo</orth>, v. coassatio.</entryFree>
coaxo: <entryFree id="n8787" type="main" key="co^axo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏaxo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. coasso.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8788" type="main" key="co^axo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏaxo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>the natural sound of frogs; cf. <foreign lang="greek">koa/c</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n8788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to croak</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>; Auct. Phil. 62; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Get. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cobiamachus: <entryFree id="n8789" type="main" key="Cobiama^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cobiamăchus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cobiom-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a village in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">between Tolosa and Narbo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cobio: <entryFree id="n8790" type="main" key="cobio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cobio</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cobius</orth>, v. gobio and gobius.</entryFree>
cobion: <entryFree id="n8791" type="greek" key="co_bi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōbĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kw/bion</foreign>, <sense id="n8791.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of the plant</hi> tithymalus (<hi rend="ital">wolf</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-milk</hi>), <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> dendroides <hi rend="ital">and</hi> leptophyllon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 45, § 71</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cocalus: <entryFree id="n8792" type="main" key="Co_ca^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōcălus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mythic king in Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who gave protection to Dœdalus when he fled from the persecution of Minos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 261</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8792.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōcălĭ-des</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the daughters of Cocalus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:42" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cocceius: <entryFree id="n8793" type="main" key="Cocce_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Coccēius</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n8793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of an Italic</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n8793.1" n="I" level="1"> Cocceius Nerva, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 28</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n8793.2" n="II" level="1"> M. Cocceius Nerva, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated lawyer under Tiberius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:58 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 58 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8793.3" n="III" level="1"> M. Cocceius Nerva, <hi rend="ital">grandson of the preceding</hi>, Inscr Orell. 1634; <hi rend="ital">emperor</hi>, A.U.C. 849-851, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:70:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 70, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coccinatus: <entryFree id="n8794" type="hapax" key="cocci^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coccĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coccinus</etym>, <sense id="n8794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed in scarlet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:97:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 97, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:37:2" default="NO">5, 37, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coccineus: <entryFree id="n8795" type="main" key="cocci^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coccĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coccum</etym>, <sense id="n8795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scarlet-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 32, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tomentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacernae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:131" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 131</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>— </sense><sense id="n8795.1" n="II" level="1"> Access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">coccĭnus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">acini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gausapa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 28, 4</bibl></cit>. laena, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:283" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 283</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aluta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:29:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 29, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8795.2" n="b" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">plur subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">coccĭna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">scarlet garments</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:39:1:2:43:8:14:131:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 39, 1, 2, 43, 8, 14, 131, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8795.3" n="c" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">sing. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">coccĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = coccum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 1, 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coccum: <entryFree id="n8796" type="greek" key="coccum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coccum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko)kkos</foreign> (a berry, and specif.), <sense id="n8796.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The berry that grows upon the scarlet oak</hi> (Quercus coccifera, Linn.; acc. to modern botany a kind of insect, <hi rend="ital">cochineal kermes</hi>), <hi rend="ital">with which scarlet was colored</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 8, 12, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:140" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 41, 65, § 140</bibl>.—Also used in medicine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 4, 4, § 8 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8796.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8796.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Scarlet color</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubro cocco tingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:23:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 23, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cocco fulgere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:76:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 76, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguineum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8796.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Scarlet garments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cloth</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:396" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 396</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n8796.4" n="II" level="1"> Coccum Gnidium, also called granum Gnidium, <hi rend="ital">a grain of the shrub</hi> thymelaea cnestron, or cneoron, used in medicine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 35, § 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:70" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 9, 46, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 134" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 134</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coccygia: <entryFree id="n8797" type="greek" key="coccy_gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coccȳgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n8797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">kokkugi/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of sumach used in coloring</hi>, perh. Rhus cotinus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 41, § 121</bibl>. <cb n="COCO" /></sense></entryFree>
coccymelum: <entryFree id="n8798" type="greek" key="coccy_me_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coccȳmēlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kokku/mhlon</foreign>, <sense id="n8798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plum</hi>, Cloat. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 7, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coccyx: <entryFree id="n8799" type="greek" key="coccyx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coccyx</orth>, <itype>ȳgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/kkuc</foreign>, <sense id="n8799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cuckoo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:25 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 9, 11, § 25 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cocetum: <entryFree id="n8800" type="greek" key="coce_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cocētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. from <foreign lang="greek">kukew/n</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n8800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of food prepared from honey and poppies</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 12</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=39:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 39, 8</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
cochlacae: <entryFree id="n8801" type="gloss" key="cochlacae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cochlacae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cocl-</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/xlakes</foreign>, <sense id="n8801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">round stones from a river</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resembling snails</hi>' <hi rend="ital">shells</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=39:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 39, 7</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
cochlea: <entryFree id="n8802" type="main" key="co_^chle^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cō^chlĕa</orth>, v. coclea.</entryFree>
cochlear: <entryFree id="n8803" type="main" key="co_^chle^ar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cō^chlĕar</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cochleatus</orth>, etc., v. cocl.</entryFree>
cochlis: <entryFree id="n8804" type="greek" key="cochlis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cochlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">koxli/s</foreign>, <sense id="n8804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone like a snail-shell in form</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 74, § 194</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cochloe: <entryFree id="n8805" type="greek" key="cochloe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cochloe</orth>, <itype>ōn</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ko/xloi</foreign>, <sense id="n8805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of shell-fishes with spiral shells</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 147</bibl> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cociator: <entryFree id="n8806" type="gloss" key="coci^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cocĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">metabo/los</foreign>, cocio, <sense id="n8806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a broker</hi>, Gloss. Vet. (prob. for cocĭōnātor).</sense></entryFree>
cocibilis: <entryFree id="n8807" type="main" key="co^ci^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏcĭbĭlis</orth>, v. coquibilis.</entryFree>
cocinatorius: <entryFree id="n8808" type="main" key="co^ci_na_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏcīnātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. coquinatorius.</entryFree>
cocio: <entryFree id="n8809" type="main" key="co_ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōcĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōtĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">coctio</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=20:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 20, 12</bibl>, and 51, 3 Müll. <sense id="n8809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. cunctor</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a broker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">factor;</hi> acc. to Gell. more usu. called arilator (v. h. v. and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=20" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 20</bibl>), Laber ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cocionatura: <entryFree id="n8810" type="gloss" key="co_ci^o_na_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōcĭōnātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cocio</etym>, <foreign lang="greek">meta/prasis</foreign>, <sense id="n8810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brokery</hi>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
cocionor: <entryFree id="n8811" type="hapax" key="co_ci^o_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōcĭōnor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be a broker</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 21</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
coclea: <entryFree id="n8812" type="main" key="co_^cle^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cō^clĕa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cō^chlĕa</orth>; cf. the letter C), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">koxli/as, o/</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n8812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a snail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom caletur cocleae in occulto latent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:173 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 56, 82, § 173 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 64, 133</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 49, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudae,</quote> <trans><tr>without shells</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 36, § 112</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">an emblem of slowness,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8812.1" n="b" level="4"> In cocleam, <hi rend="ital">snail-formed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spiral</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per cocleam ascendebat in cenaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8812.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8812.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A snail-shell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:18:23" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 18, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8812.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A screw of a press</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8812.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A machine for drawing water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a water-snail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">waterscrew</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8812.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A door that moves easily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 3</bibl> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
coclear: <entryFree id="n8813" type="main" key="co^cle^ar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏclĕar</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cochl-</orth>), <itype>āris</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏclĕārĭ-um</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 122" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:96" default="NO">96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 22</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏclĕāre</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:71:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 71, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:14:121" default="NO">8, 14, 121</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">coclĕārum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 89, § 242</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>coclea, of the form of a snail-shell</etym>, <sense id="n8813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spoon</hi>, Mart. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 33, 6 al.</bibl>—As <hi rend="ital">a measure for liquids</hi>, esp. in medicine, <hi rend="ital">a spoonful</hi>, = half a cheme or 1/144 of a cotyla, Rhem. Fann. Pond.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 38, § 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:17" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 4, 5, § 17</bibl>, and the above passages with coclearium.</sense></entryFree>
coclearium: <entryFree id="n8814" type="main" key="cocle^a_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coclĕārĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cochl-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>coclea</etym>. <sense id="n8814.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An enclosure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pen in which snails were kept and fed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:14:1" default="NO">3, 14, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n8814.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A spoon;</hi> v. cochlear.</sense></entryFree>
cocleatim: <entryFree id="n8815" type="hapax" key="cocle^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coclĕātim</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cochl-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spirally</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
cocleatus: <entryFree id="n8816" type="main" key="cocle^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coclĕātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cochl-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spiral</hi> or <hi rend="ital">screw-formed</hi>: equuleus, Pomp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 105, 15</bibl>, and 182, 14: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Anim. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cocleola: <entryFree id="n8817" type="main" key="cocle^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coclĕŏla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cochl-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small snail</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64</bibl>, n. 19; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Jov. 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cocles: <entryFree id="n8818" type="main" key="co_^cles1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cō^cles</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>for scoculus; root ska-; cf. <foreign lang="greek">skia/, sko/tos</foreign>, and oculus (cf. Fleck. in Rhein. Mus. 8, p. 231)</etym>, <sense id="n8818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cognomen of a person blind with one eye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 55, § 150</bibl>; so Enn. ap. Varr L. L. 7, § 71; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 1, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8819" type="main" key="Co_^cles2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cō^cles</orth>, <itype>itis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cognomen of a Roman</hi>, Horatius Cocles. who, in the war with Porsenna, defended a bridge alone, Liv 2, 10, 2 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 18, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 650</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 5, 11, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:100 al" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 15, 23, § 100 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 11, 63; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 120:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 120, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coco: <entryFree id="n8820" type="main" key="coco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coco</orth>, acc. to others <orth extent="full" lang="la">cocococo</orth>, <sense id="n8820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the sound naturally made by the hen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clucking</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 59, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cocolobis: <entryFree id="n8821" type="foreign" key="co^co^lo^bis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏcŏlŏbis</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏcŏlŭbis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Spanish name for a kind of grape.</hi>—Form <pb n="358" /> <cb n="CODI" /> -ŭbis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 19</bibl>.—Form -ŏbis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cocosates: <entryFree id="n8822" type="main" key="Cocosa_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cocosātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tribe in Aquitania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cocta: <entryFree id="n8823" type="main" key="cocta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cocta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. coquo, I. A. <sense id="n8823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
coctana: <entryFree id="n8824" type="main" key="cocta^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coctăna</orth>, v. cottana.</entryFree>
coctilicius: <entryFree id="n8825" type="main" key="cocti^li^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coctĭlĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>coctilis</etym>, <sense id="n8825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to dried wood</hi>: taberna, <hi rend="ital">in which dry wood is sold</hi>, Capit. Pert. 3; others less correctly coactiliaria.</sense></entryFree>
coctilis: <entryFree id="n8826" type="main" key="cocti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coctĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coquo</etym>, <sense id="n8826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">burned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 193</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muri (Babylonis),</quote> <trans><tr>built of burned bricks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. Curt. l. l., and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl> (cocto latere). —</sense><sense id="n8826.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">coctĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. ligna), <hi rend="ital">very dry wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that burns without smoke</hi> (cf. acapnos), Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 14</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:55:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 55, § 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coctio: <entryFree id="n8827" type="main" key="cocti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n8827.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cooking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calcis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8827.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A digesting of food</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 39, § 101</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n8828" type="main" key="cocti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, v. cocio.</entryFree>
coctito: <entryFree id="n8829" type="main" key="cocti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coctĭto</orth>, v. coquito.</entryFree>
coctivus: <entryFree id="n8830" type="main" key="cocti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coctīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coquo</etym>, <sense id="n8830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is easily cooked</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ripens early</hi> (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">suitable for cooking</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">castaneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condimenta,</quote> <trans><tr>used in cooking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:9:4" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coctor: <entryFree id="n8831" type="main" key="coctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (more rare than coquus), <sense id="n8831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cook</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 95, 8</bibl>: calcis, <hi rend="ital">a limeburner</hi>, Edict. Diocl. p. 19; Cod. Th. 14, 6, 1.</sense></entryFree>
coctura: <entryFree id="n8832" type="main" key="coctu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coctūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cooking; a melting; a manner</hi> or <hi rend="ital">style of cooking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:23, p. 453" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 23, p. 453</bibl> Bip.: <cit><quote lang="la">Apiciana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 143</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:96" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 8, 20, § 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:6:2 al" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 6, 2 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Nov. 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8832.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8832.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A temperature of the air adapted to the ripening</hi> (<hi rend="ital">of fruit</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8832.3" n="B" level="2"> (Abstr. pro concr.) <hi rend="ital">A boiling liquid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:7" default="NO">12, 18, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cocturarius: <entryFree id="n8833" type="gloss" key="coctu_ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coctūrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cook</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e(yhth/s</foreign>, Gloss. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
coctus: <entryFree id="n8834" type="main" key="coctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from coquo.</entryFree>
cocula: <entryFree id="n8835" type="main" key="co^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏcŭla</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏquula</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>coquus</etym>, <sense id="n8835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female cook</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 531, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
coculum: <entryFree id="n8836" type="main" key="co^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>coquo</etym>. * <sense id="n8836.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A vessel for cooking</hi>, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 8, 1</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=39:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 39, 2</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n8836.1" n="II" level="1"> Acc. to some, <hi rend="ital">small wood for cooking</hi>, Paul. ex Fest. l. l.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Gloss. Isid.</author> Plac. p. 448</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
cocus: <entryFree id="n8837" type="main" key="co^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cŏcus</orth>, v. coquus.</entryFree>
cocytus: <entryFree id="n8838" type="main" key="Co_cy_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōcȳtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kwkuto)s</foreign> [river of lamentation, from <foreign lang="greek">kwku)w</foreign>, to howl, weep], <sense id="n8838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mythic river in the Lower World</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 479</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 297</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 323</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:14:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 14, 18 al.</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Gr. Cocyton, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 353</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Heyne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6</bibl></cit> Excurs. IX.—</sense><sense id="n8838.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōcȳtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Cocytus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 120, 69</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and Cocytia aequora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 2, 471</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo, i. e. Alecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 479</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
coda: <entryFree id="n8839" type="main" key="co_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. cauda.</entryFree>
codeta: <entryFree id="n8840" type="main" key="Co_de_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōdēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>coda = cauda</etym>, <sense id="n8840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in which grew plants resembling the tails of horses.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8840.1" n="I" level="1"> Codeta Major, <hi rend="ital">a place beyond the Tiber</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=58:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 58, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=38:17" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 38, 17</bibl> Müll.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Codētānus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: campus, Reg. Urb. Rom. 14.—</sense><sense id="n8840.2" n="II" level="1"> Codeta Minor, <hi rend="ital">a place near the Campus Martius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 1, p. 656, annot. 1414.</sense></entryFree>
codex: <entryFree id="n8841" type="main" key="co_dex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōdex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, v. caudex.</entryFree>
codicarius: <entryFree id="n8842" type="main" key="co_di^ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōdĭcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. caudicarius.</entryFree>
codicillaris: <entryFree id="n8843" type="main" key="co_di^cilla_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōdĭcillāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cōdĭcillārius</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: dignitates, Cod. Th. 6, 22, 7), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>codicilli, II. B. 1.</etym>, <sense id="n8843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">named</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appointed by the emperor</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s handwriting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auguratus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
codicilli: <entryFree id="n8844" type="main" key="co_di^cilli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōdĭcilli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (<number>sing.</number> post-class. and rare in the meaning II. B. 2. infra, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 5, 4, § 5</bibl>; Cod. Th. 8, 18, 7; 16, 5, 40; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:7:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 7, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:148" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 16, 148</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>codex = caudex</etym>. <sense id="n8844.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Wood cut and split for burning</hi>, only in <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 37, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">130</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n8844.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to caudex, III., a writing-tablet; hence) <hi rend="ital">A writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">letter</hi>, esp. <hi rend="ital">a short writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">note</hi>, <hi rend="ital">billet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a petition</hi>, etc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 13, 27, § 89</bibl>, and 33, 1, 4, § 12. </sense><sense id="n8844.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 10, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 9</bibl> (11), 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 8, 2</bibl>: cum <cb n="COEM" /> codicillis venit puer, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 55:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 55, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 15 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 15 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n8844.3" n="B" level="2"> Specif., in the time of the empire, </sense><sense id="n8844.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A writing of the emperor conferring some privilege</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a diploma</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cabinet order</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:22:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 22, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 29</bibl>; Cod. Th. 6, 4, 23.—</sense><sense id="n8844.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A brief testamentary order</hi>, usu. <hi rend="ital">as an addition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appendix to a will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a codicil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 16, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29</bibl>, tit. 7: de jure codicillorum.</sense></entryFree>
codicillus: <entryFree id="n8845" type="main" key="co_di^cillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōdĭcillus</orth>, v. codicilli <sense id="n8845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
codicula: <entryFree id="n8846" type="hapax" key="co_di^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cōdĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>coda = cauda</etym>, <sense id="n8846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little tail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:1" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 1</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
codomannus: <entryFree id="n8847" type="main" key="Codomannus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Codomannus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cognomen of the last Persian king Darius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:6" default="NO">11, 6</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
codrio: <entryFree id="n8848" type="main" key="Codrio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Codrio</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Codrion</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Greek Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 27, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
codrus: <entryFree id="n8849" type="main" key="Co_drus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cōdrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ko/dros</foreign>. <sense id="n8849.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The last Athenian king</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who voluntarily devoted himself to death in order to obtain for his people victory over the Spartans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 6, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8849.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A wretched poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostile to Virgil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:203" default="NO">3, 203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:208" default="NO">3, 208</bibl>; cf. Weich. Poett. Latt. Rell. p. 402 sq.</sense></entryFree>
coel: <entryFree id="n8850" type="main" key="coel"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coel</orth>, v. caelum.</entryFree>
coela: <entryFree id="n8851" type="main" key="Coela"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Coela</orth> (ōrum, <gen>n.</gen>), Euboeae, <foreign lang="greek">*koi=la th=s *eu)boi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n8851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deeply-indented maritime region in Eubœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 47, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 10</bibl>; hence this part of Eubœa is also called Coela Euboea, Val. Max. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
coelator: <entryFree id="n8852" type="main" key="coela_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">coelātor</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">coelātūra</orth>, v. cael-.</entryFree>
coelesyria: <entryFree id="n8853" type="main" key="Coele_ Sy^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Coelē Syrĭa</orth>, or in one word <orth extent="full" lang="la">Coe-lēsyrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*koi/lh *suri)a</foreign> (lit. <sense id="n8853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Hollow Syria</hi>), <hi rend="ital">Cœlesyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Libanus and Antilibanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 20, 17, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 19, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 29, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:5:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 9</bibl>. —Called simply Coele, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 12, 13, § 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:81 al" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 23, 19, § 81 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> COELES SYRIAE, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 10</bibl>, n. 215; <case>acc.</case> Coelen Syriam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 11, 6</bibl>.—Syria Coele, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 72, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
